definition[0]: something that a company sells very successfully and that brings in a lot of money
definition[1]: a very profitable business or part of a business
example[0]: Mail order should be seen as a cash cow that will generate cash for further moves into information services.
example[1]: GM and Ford have used luxury cars as cash cows; giving those up could have a terrible impact on profitability.
definition[2]: in the GROWTH/SHARE MATRIX, a product with high market share in a low-growth market
